text: I stared at the light of the ritual circle, my throat tightening as if something were blocking it.
The chanting of the robed figures grew faster, the air trembling like water. Lucia was about to rush forward, but I grabbed her arm and held her back.
“Let go of me!” she shouted, panic flashing in her eyes. “The mentor is still in there!”
“No!” I barked under my breath. “The circle is going to—”
🎲 [Will Check: Success] You force yourself to turn away, suppressing the instinct to look back.
I pulled Lucia by the hand and ran with everything I had toward the stairs.
A deafening boom erupted behind us. Blue light surged like a tidal wave, swallowing the entire chamber. We were thrown down onto the freezing steps.
I half-dragged her as we stumbled through the iron gate.
Cold wind filled my lungs, and the glare of the snow stung my eyes.
Lucia tore her hand free and turned back toward the door. Her voice trembled. “The mentor… she’s still down there!”
“We can’t go back!” I shouted, almost losing my voice. “It’s already collapsed!”
She froze, her eyes vacant. The wind tossed her hair, and snowflakes settled on her face one by one.
“Why… why did you pull me away?” Her voice quivered. “She… she was still…”
I opened my mouth, but no words came out.
Another tremor rumbled beneath us. The iron door finally gave way, collapsing inward. Blue light seeped through the cracks—then vanished.
Lucia fell to her knees in the snow, covering her face as sobs broke free—hoarse, hollow, and terrifyingly quiet.
I watched her back, my chest hollowed out. The wind roared down the street, extinguishing the lantern we came by.
I looked down—the brass die in my hand rolled under the moonlight and stopped on a ‘20’.
I laughed softly. It wasn’t joy—just bitterness.
“Fate… even with a perfect roll, I still couldn’t save anyone.”
Lucia didn’t answer. She stood slowly, her back to me, voice barely above a whisper. “Go.”
In the snow, two sets of footprints remained—one deep, one shallow—slowly drifting apart.
【Bad Ending: The Fugitive of Fate】
You survived. But the snow that fell that night… never melted again.
